findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of a contract is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially alter the state of the contract.

findings.title: Lack of ownable.sol import
findings.description: The smart contract does not utilize ownable.sol import, which may lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Smart contract ownership cannot be transferred or renounced
findings.description: The smart contract has an active ownership set to 0x78b2439ff083ca3ba6719e863cbe695087db4b1d, which creates a centralization risk and can lead to rug pull scams if not mitigated.

findings.title: Unrestricted liquidity setting
findings.description: Smart contract owner can set liquidity without any restrictions, which may be used to stop users from buying, selling or transferring assets.

findings.title: Centralization Risk
findings.description: ECOMOVE's smart contract has an active ownership which creates a risk of rug pull scams and centralization hacks.
